definition: to count out (a sum of money etc)
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: They could even count the fruit in Soviet orchards and analyze their crops.
sentences.chinese: 他们甚至可以数出苏联果园里的果树并分析其产量。

sentences.english: You then count the number of marks, and this will give you the height of the building in barometer units.
sentences.chinese: 数出标记总数，再乘以气压计的单位长度，得出楼高。

sentences.english: Tyrion counted six, oaken chests with iron hasps.
sentences.chinese: 提利昂数出了六个橡木铁搭扣的箱子。

sentences.english: Afterwards they were asked to count the money they had earned out of an envelope.
sentences.chinese: 最后他们将从一个信封中数出他们所挣的钱。

sentences.english: How many ice lollies can you count in the circle?
sentences.chinese: 在圆圈里你能数出多少个雪糕？

sentences.english: I can always count his breath. One, two, three, exhale. Four, five, six, inhale.
sentences.chinese: 我可以数出他呼吸的节拍，一二三呼气，四五六吸气。

definition: banknote in Jiao units (Mao, one-tenth of yuan)
erhua variant of 挨個|挨个[ai1 ge4]
to make uniform/to even up/to make good a deficiency
number off! (command in military drill)/count off!
(in former times) banknote with a value in silver
